isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - SPECIAL PROCEDURES - AUXILIARY SECTION IN CHASSIS

svcproc.title: AUXILIARY SECTION IN CHASSIS
svcproc.para: The following procedure covers the removal of the auxiliary section with the transmission remaining in the chassis.

step1.para: Place the range selector on the shift knob in the down position to shift the transmission into low range. Removing the auxiliary section when the transmission is in low range will aid in reassembly ( Figure 12).
Disconnect the driveshaft and U-joint from the output yoke.

If the auxiliary section is to be disassembled, remove the output nut using a 2-3/4 inch or 70 mm socket. To prevent the output shaft from rotating while removing the nut, shift the transmission to 1st gear.

caution.para: If the shift bar housing is still installed, you MUST perform steps 5 and 6 or the transmission will be damaged.

step1.para: Remove the bolts from the range bar lock cover, and rotate the lock cover counter-clockwise until the notch on the cover lines up with the unlock symbol ( Figure 13).

note.para: If the system still contains air pressure, greater force is required to turn the lock cover.

step1.para: Insert the right bolt to secure the cover in the unlock position (Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Remove Bolts From Range Bar Lock Cover

note.para: This step unlocks the range yoke bar in the auxiliary from the range piston bar in the shift bar housing.

step1.para: Drive the two dowel pins forward, and remove them ( Figure 14).
Remove 18 of the 19 bolts that secure the auxiliary section to the main section. Leave one bolt to secure housing until it is ready to be removed ( Figure 14).

note.para: Bolts are different lengths. Note their locations for reassembly purposes.

step1.para: Clean and oil the three threaded pusher holes in the auxiliary section flange. To clean them, thread an M10x1.5 tap into each hole to remove paint, rust, and other debris (Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Remove Dowel Pins and Bolts

warning.para: Use proper equipment with safety chains attached to remove auxiliary section. The auxiliary section can slide rearward and could fall, causing you serious injury and/or damage to the auxiliary section.

step1.para: Attach the chain and lifting device to the auxiliary section hanger, or attach the support jack to the auxiliary section.

Thread bolts into each of the three previously cleaned pusher holes in the auxiliary section flange. Run the bolts in evenly to break the gasket seal and move the auxiliary housing rearward approximately 1/4 inch. After breaking the gasket seal, remove pusher screws.

caution.para: The weight of the auxiliary section must be supported during removal to avoid damage to the range yoke bar.

step1.para: Support the weight of the auxiliary section with the lifting device or support jack and move the auxiliary section rearward until it is free from the front section of the transmission.
